[ Package Index | Mudlib Index | Effect Index ]

File /std/guilds/standard.c

This is where you would set up any shadows you want on the player object, or just do what you will..

Inherits

This class inherits the following classes /std/object.c

Includes

This class includes the following files /include/config.h, /include/tune.h, /include/skills.h and /include/guilds.h

Public Functions

These are functions that everyone can access.

.
add_command
int add_command(string name,
int add_if_player)
add_position
int add_position(string sub_guild,
string position,
int max,
string * abilities,
mixed * description)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method adds a new position for the subguild.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - position to add
max - the maximum number of people appointed to this position
abilities - the abilities associated with this position
description - the descriptions associated with this position ({ title|({male_title,female_title}), ... })
Returns:
DEITY_POSITION_OK if successful, DEITY_POSITION_FAIL if the position already exists
See also:
remove_position(), query_position() and query_positions()
add_spell
int add_spell(string name,
mixed ob,
string func_name,
int add_if_player)
adjust_primaries
string adjust_primaries(object thing,
int level)
appoint_position
int appoint_position(string sub_guild,
string position,
string player_name)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method appoints the player to a position. If sub_guild is 0, the guild object is supposed to figure out the subguild from the player_name.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - the position
player_name - the player
Returns:
POSITION_FAIL if it failed, POSITION_OK if it succeeded.
cast_spell
int cast_spell(string name,
mixed bing)
dismiss_position
int dismiss_position(string sub_guild,
string position,
string player_name)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method dismisses the player from a position. If sub_guild is 0, the guild object is supposed to figure out the subguild from the player_name.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - the position
player_name - the player
Returns:
POSITION_FAIL if it failed, POSITION_OK if it succeeded.

mixed param)

object thing)

void player_quit()

void player_save()
query_commands
string * query_commands()
query_gp_skill
string query_gp_skill()
query_guild_ability
int query_guild_ability(mixed thing,
string ability)
Dummy function for guilds without positions Test if a player/npc has a specific ability.

Parameters:
thing - either a string, being the name of a player, or an object being the actual player/npc to check for a guild ability.
ability - the ability to check for.
Returns:
1 if thing has that ability, 0 if not.
query_level
int query_level(object thing)
This method figures out the level of the npc or player.

Parameters:
thing - the thing to find the level of
Returns:
the level of the thing
query_position
string query_position(string sub_guild,
string player_name)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method returns the position held by the player. If sub_guild is 0, the guild object is supposed to figure out what sub_guild (if any) is relevant.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
player_name - the player
Returns:
the position the player is appointed to in sub_guild.
query_position_abilities
string * query_position_abilities(string sub_guild,
string position)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method returns the abilities for a position.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - position to return
Returns:
0 if the position don't exist, an array of abilities if is does
See also:
add_position()
query_position_appointments
string * query_position_appointments(string sub_guild,
string position)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method returns the appointments for this position in this subguild.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - position to return
Returns:
0 if the position don't exist, an array of appointments if is does, with 0's for unfilled positions
See also:
add_position()
query_position_description
mixed * query_position_description(string sub_guild,
string position)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method returns the description array for this position.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - position to return
Returns:
0 if the position don't exist, an array of descriptions if it does, currently defined to hold the title ({ title|({male_title,female_title}), ... })
See also:
add_position()
query_positions
mapping query_positions(string sub_guild,
string position)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method returns all positions for this guild.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
Returns:
0 if the position don't exist, an array of appointments if is does, with 0's for unfilled positions
See also:
add_position()

Parameters:

Returns:
the title name

remove_position
int remove_position(string sub_guild,
string position)
Dummy function for guilds without positions This method removes a position for this subguild.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
position - position to remove
Returns:
POSITION_OK if successful, POSITION_FAIL if the position didn't exist
See also:
add_position(), query_position() and query_positions()

Dummy function for guilds without positions This method removes all appointments for a guild.

Parameters:
sub_guild - the sub guild
See also:

skills_advanced
void skills_advanced(object thing,
string skill,
int level)
This method is called whenever a player advances a skill.

Parameters:
thing - the player advacing the skill
skill - the name of the skill
level - the level it is advanced to
